Reviews.Title: A few thoughts
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I just had a couple of observations about both the tv itself, as well as the process of buying it. First, I want to mention that I ordered this tv on an evening where the price was 1368...or close to it. Sometime during the night, amazon lowered the price to 1299 and this was the price I ended up being charged. To my mind, that's just doing the right thing. Many companies would have just charged the higher price and waited to see if I caught it and called. So, credit to Amazon, well done.Delivery and packaging was excellent. The shipping company wanted to deliver several days after my expected delivery date. But, upon learning that this was the date given to me by amazon, they quickly amended the ship date. The tv arrived in perfect condition and the crew was pleasant.I really thought I was going to return this when I first powered it up. The picture was pretty bad and even though the settings are quite far off out of the box, it was more than that. But (and I'm not clear on why), after it hit the two hour mark or so, it really came to life. It focused, and most of the issues were corrected by this brief warm up period. It only happened the first time, and now it's ready to go as soon as you power it on.The tv itself is pretty solid as a budget led would go. Once dialed in, colors are good, picture overall is quite pleasing. This is a direct lit display coming in somewhere between edge lit and full array. as a result, it has good uniformity throughout and no light bleed on any edges. And, it does have a pretty thin bezel. The downside to the direct lit is the thickness. this tv is thick by todays standards.I just want to be clear, it's not a high end set. It doesn't have the black levels or motion handling of a plasma but, it does have the advantages of being an led lit LCD panel. You can play games, hook up your computer, forget to turn it off, or pretty much view whatever you want without fear of burn in or image retention. Do plasmas still have burn and ir in 2013? You bet they do, even with pixel orbiters and screen wash. But, it's a use case. I have a Mac mini and an Xbox on it, I needed the led. If it were movies only...it would have been a Panasonic plasma. All that said, for the money, it's a pretty darn good tv.A few small things worth mentioning. The remote is pretty particular about being pointed right at the lower left hand corner of the set to work. The set can be slow moving through menus. I have not tried the sound as its being fed from a pioneer receiver. Wireless worked great and connected to an apple AirPort Extreme without a hitch. I can't really speak to the apps. I have them on a roku 3, Apple TV 3, oppo 103 blue ray player, and of course the Xbox. So, really...how many times do you even bother setting it up. For what it's worth, the roku 3 is the way to go IMHO.

Reviews.Title: I use this as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Review
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use as a large computer monitor to use from my couch. Therefore, I have not connected it to the internet nor do I use any of the apps or "smart TV" features. To make one reviewer happy, I'm reviewing the 65" version.I just received this and finished setting it up. A few helpful notes:1. One reviewer states that the remote is very sensitive to being pointed at a certain corner. This was not my experience. I can point the remote at the ceiling, floor, left, right and it still works (both the number pad and qwerty keyboard on the bottom). My TV is on a stand and not in a closet, which maybe the cause of that reviewer's problem.2. I managed to attach the stand and lift it onto the table by myself but it was a struggle and would have been much easier with someone else.3. Pilot Freight, the company which delivered the TV was an hour early, arriving at noon when my scheduled delivery was 1-3 PM. Thankfully the TV arrived undamaged. I did not mind but it was unexpected.4. I was initially shocked at the terrible input lag. I don't game with this monitor but there was a solid 500 ms lag out of the box. It was frustrating even for basic web browsing/moving a cursor around. I turned on "Game Mode" which drastically reduced the lag. There is still some lag but it's acceptable for basic use. I'm not picky about input lag and I came from a monitor which is known to have some lag but this thing is significantly worse, and even I notice it. I wouldn't do any heavy computer gaming on it. I don't know about console gaming.5. The settings out of the box weren't too bad. I ended up going with this:Picture Mode: Any setting you want but keep in mind you can't change the backlight until you disable the light sensor setting in advanced picture options.Backlight: 40 (I sit relatively close so you may prefer higher, I'm writing this review 2 feet from it but I normally sit about 75-85 inches from it).Brightness: 51Contrast: 60Color: 60Tint: -2Sharpness: 6Color Temperature: CustomRed Gain: 48Green Gain: 48Blue Gain: 46Red Offset: 50Green Offset: 50Blue Offset: 50Under advanced picture I turned everything off since I rely on my computer for most of those settings.6. The speakers almost completely lack bass and are basically unsable unless you don't care at all about sound. Even my crappy 4.1 computer speakers with a little 6" subwoofer from over a decade ago are miles ahead. Just don't buy this TV expecting it to replace any kind of dedicated speakers. This is par for the course for TVs so I don't really count it against this TV. I wanted to address this because some reviewers were complaining about the speakers and you really shouldn't expect much.7. Some people complain about the stand but unless you try to knock it over or your kids hit it, it wont fall over on its own even if you nudge it. The stand is fine.8. For the price and size, this TV is great.9 You can get Dobly Digital from the optical output by going into the advanced audio settings and changing "Digital Audio Out" from "PCM" to "Dobly Digital".10. The remote is nice and basic. It's sturdy, looks good, and takes two AAA batteries. I don't use the qwerty keyboard but I don't find myself in danger of pressing them while using the top side of the remote and even if I did, they don't do anything unless you're in the right menu.11. The finish on the screen is anti-reflective but I would call it semigloss. Mine sits next to two windows and I notice some diffused glare on the black screen but none if there is a picture or anything other than black.I gave this 4 stars because:1. I wanted to turn the sharpness off but for some reason 0 was completely blurry and 6 seemed the most natural. This is annoying as I just want it to output the pure signal from my video card.2. Input lag3. I would have loved a lower price without the "smart" features. "Smart" features seem to be unavoidable these days. My computer is "smarter" than this TV will ever be.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: Anne "Anne"
Reviews.Content: I was debating this TV with the Panasonic TC-P65S60 65-Inch 1080p which is currently exactly the same price (~$1300).  In my case it came down to the bright room, and the annoying reflections I had with my previous plasma (55 inch Samsung).  This TV definitely has less glare, which is great for my environment.  if you room is dark, the Panasonic probably is as good or better.Everything works fine.  The shipping by Pilot was flawless, and they set up the TV and took away the box etc.  no problems. I took the advice of others and turned off all the video features, especially the  light sensor which makes the screen too dim.  When all is off, the colors are great.  I see no problems with the blacks, but I am no expert.  It is similar to my previous plasma though.The best app is YouTube, which is not available on Roku  3(very important to point out!).  O/w I agree that "SMART" TVs aren't really worth it.  A basic TV with a great picture beats that any day.I have tried most features, and they work fine.  Streaming is excellent (wired/wireless similar).  Set up is quite simple.  4 hdmi ports is very useful to maximally use features.  Agree the sound isn't the best, but that is the same for all TVs.  adequate for me.The remote is kind of cute with a keyboard on one side, and standard buttons on the other.  it can be useful for some of the onscreen menus.  I do find it is hard to turn on/off the TV.  you do have to point the remote a little more than others to get it to work.  However, not a deal breaker.  Wish the remote was backlit though.  a pain when it is dark.It is definitely a big tv, much larger than my prior.  But perfect for my location.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Super Lightweight, easy to put together and an clean crisp amazing view!  Its like having a theater in our house.

Reviews.Title: Why buy a Sony when Vizio delivers a great picture
Reviews.Author: Moto bionic
Reviews.Content: This Vizio has a great picture and we are very happy with it after a couple weeks.  Our last big screen TV purchase was a mid-high level Sony - over $2200 and it lasted 4 years!  This Vizio is a smart TV (Sony was not) and a few inches bigger screen, and was nearly 1/3 the price of the Sony which lasted all of 4 years.  Why spend all the money on a Sony that isn't going to last?  The Sony remote batteries outlasted the TV!  I understand I'm comparing a 4 year old LCD Sony with a new LED Vizio, but the Vizio picture blows away the Sony.  I also understand prices have come down in 4 years, but I see no point paying for a more expensive TV when something like this Vizio does the job.  The sound on the Sony was better, but it had built in sound bar-type front speakers.Delivered was as promised - was a great way to buy a TV.  Had never bought one online before, and Amazon made it a smooth process.  If any TV stops working, etc., Best Buy or other stores don't do anything about it, you have to call for service so it's no different buying from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing picture. Get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Chad D. Hummel
Reviews.Content: Bottom of consumer reports larger than 60" category.  Also wrong sticker for the energy guide. It reads $9/yr in the amazon picture and $9 on the tv when you get it but its actually $43/yr.Disappointed in the picture quality. Maybe some setting changes could help. Its calbrated using WOW.  There is some noticeable fuzziness with any movement on screen. When there is not much movement its a decent picture. When focused on the main object or person its clear but the background is very grainy . I don't have those problems on my 5 yr old lcd samsung..  Comparing the two the Vizio is not very good. Perhaps if it was my first HDTV I may not notice these issues. Maybe the fact the Samsung is 52" and this is 65" plays a part in the pic quality. I think the 120hz isn't as good as the samsungs 120hz.Pros:  Price, decent but not perfect picture quality 8/10Cons:  Picture quality 8/10 (yes- also a con since I feel as if I'm downgrading)  Remote  has to be directed towards the tv more than most remotes to recognize button presses  The stand, doesn't seem sturdy as most , that being said it wont tip on its own  Sound quality is poor, but many use external speakers anyway  The smart tv part of this is awful - apps are very very slow to load.  40 sec to start netflix rather than 5 sec on Roku. I wouldnt pay extra for a SmartTv. Leave that to dedicated devices unless its a  high end higher priced tv that can process faster.  The TV takes about 20 seconds to boot up after the power button is pressed.  Lines , streaks, and fuzzyness around moving objects  Always a grainy background even with an almost perfect foreground image.  Glare- Its terrible. Which I can't figure out. The samsung has a glossy surface and has a lot less glare and reflections than this  tv which has only a semi glossy screen. The Samsung must use some kind of filter to reduce this effect.  The edge , even though narrow, is very glossy and not even , like its warped, so it has an awkward glare as wellTip: 1st thing, turn off the ambient light setting. Vastly improves out of the box picture. but unfortunately not enough.Note:  The free shipping takes 13 days. I thought that was long considering the facility it was sent from was 5 hours from my home. Once it reached the local facility they called and said it would be 4 days before they could deliver so I went to pick it up there (2 hours round trip) to cut 4 days off the delivery time. 1) I wanted it right away 2) I didn't want it setting in a cold warehouse for 4 days.I hope its not a hassle sending this tv back. I don't feel right spending over 1K and not being completely satisfiedEdit: 12/20/13  I see this 65" vizio is the worst rated tv in the over 60 inch category by consumer reports.  If I'd have subscribed a month earlier I wouldn't have purchased this TV I was drawn in by the low price and surprisingly good reviews.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: CarterDale "saw dust maker"
Reviews.Content: Bought from Amazon on 24 month no interest, free shipping, no tax. This is my first flat screen after waiting 3 years to find the right one. Everything works correctly so far. I read where it takes some tweaking with color, etc. yo get the picture to look right. We set the picture quality to "Vivid" and it's awesome. There are settings for football, basketball, and several others, might be overkill. Love the remote with the keyboard but haven't used it that much. Netflix is on with 2 button pushes. Lots of Apps to download too. Have no complaints after 6 weeks. How can you go wrong getting 65 inches for 1300?.PS The people who gave low marks to the Amazon card are idiots. It's no different than any other zero percent charge card out there.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: SallyridesaMustang "anna"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great and you don't need a sound bar to go with it.I really like the Iheart radio app.If you want a great tv under a thousand dollars this one is it

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "3 princesses"
Reviews.Content: TV arrived quickly.Delivery guy unpackaged and took packaging with him.We powered it on, and it was beautiful.I've had it for a few weeks now, and I've dialed in all the settings.I definitely recommend turning off all the auto features (like auto dimming).Endless ways to customize the settings to get it the way you like it.I really like the qwerty keyboard on the remote...very handy.And everyone always has a Netflix button.I like that this one has an Amazon button.Very convenient.Beautiful picture.  Can't say it enough.I watched a football game last weekend, and was just left breathless...It looks that good.

Reviews.Title: Not the TV I imagined...Amazon was great.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Pros: cost, hard to beat the priceCons: Picture quality  could not get the quality pic that I wanted. I tried all suggested settings on the net also.  remote should be backlit. FYI, first remote only the back worked. Vizio sent a replacement.  Back lighting bled through.My feeling is that Vizio does make good TV's but maybe their QC is not up to par. I purchased 2 of these sets and had similar problems  with both. The 2nd set had a grayish tinge  on the bottom 6" of the screen as well. I finally purchased a Panasonic plasma and am very pleased with it.AMAZON...was a pleasure to work with(returned both sets). Tech support was extremely helpful and professional. Kudos to their team! They made me feel like a valued customer not an annoyance. Thanks again.For those who have purchased one, maybe you should think about an extended warrantee. Very affordable through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Chelsey R. Wilson "Chelsey"
Reviews.Content: Vizio is on top for a reason. TV fit perfect in our cabinet and looks great. Picture is life-like. The built wifi makes things very convenient.

Reviews.Title: Almost five stars....
Reviews.Author: leigh98204
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the t.v.-the picture definitely needs to be on the HD channels for clarity.  Would give it five stars except for the fact that it's been 'freezing up' lately (bought it in November, it's now January) and we have to unplug the power and plug it back in to 'restart it'

Reviews.Title: Great price on an amazing TV
Reviews.Author: zachary dunaisky
Reviews.Content: This TV is simply fantastic. I went back and forth and spent a couple weeks looking at TV's before deciding on this one. The shippers called me the day of delivery and told me exactly when the driver would be here. The delivery guy helped me unbox and setup the tv to make sure everything was working before he left.After a couple weeks of using this TV to stream content from my HTPC, watch Netflix from Chromcast, play Xbox, and even use it as a giant monitor I'm absolutely satisfied with my purchase. It meets all my needs and more.CONS: remote has to be aimed in one specific spot to work. The native interface for menus and configuring the TV is pretty sluggish. A qwerty keyboard on the remote would have made the setup process a lot easier as well.PROS: The native Netflix app is surprisingly usable. Sturdy base, great picture, built in speakers work great in my apartment, and everything else.

Reviews.Title: Amazing image quality
Reviews.Author: B. Chernicoff
Reviews.Content: With some tweaking to the picture settings this TV delivers amazing image quality. The backlight is almost perfectly uniform. On a completely black frame in a dark room you can just make out some columns of slightly brighter areas, but that is when looking very hard. In practical use, even in dark scenes in movies, that very subtle difference is unnoticeable. I would call this as good as it gets in an LED backlit TV. The compromise to achieve this is the increased thickness compared to edge-lit LED TVs. In my opinion, the trade off in thickness is worth it. Color accuracy is very good with a tendency to over-saturate reds a little. Detail is great and I am referring to true detail...the out of the box sharpening was turned up way to high.I haven't tried the built-in streaming capabilities yet.I am extremely happy with my purchase.My only real criticism was the delivery process. Pilot Freight was the delivery company and the first two(!) TVs they brought had majorly smashed screens. Amazon was very helpful and issued me a store credit for the hassle. They said they were going to review with Pilot their shipping practices. The third TV arrived with a pristine box.

Reviews.Title: Vizio!
Reviews.Author: Rik
Reviews.Content: This is our second Vizio. Several years ago we purchased a 37" and have been extremely satisfied. When it was time to move up to a larger (and 1080P) model we looked at all the usual suspects and finally decided on this brand new 55" E Series from Vizio. Couldn't be happier with our choice. The difference between a 720 and 1080P is amazing. While we are not experts we certainly like what we see.

Reviews.Title: At least Amazon will help and stand by their customers
Reviews.Author: Dustin Mcclellan "McClellan"
Reviews.Content: White ghostly spot on the screen, called VIZIO and they was ZERO help.  VIZIO claimed this was normal and offered no solution.  Since VIZIO was no help, we decided to return it.  At least Amazon will help and stand by their customers.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E650 65" TV
Reviews.Author: Paul Vallhonrat
Reviews.Content: Overall it is a good TV for the money, but get an extended warranty.This replaced a Vizio 65" LED TV that developed two vertical lines in the picture after 13 months.  The lines went away after the TV was on for about 15 minutes, but they would reappear when you turned it back on.  I decided I could live with that and waited until there was a catastrophic issue.  That issue occurred about 2 months later when the entire left side was black.  Fortunately I had purchased an extended warranty, which is something I typically do not doWhen I purchased this TV as a replacement, the first one had a vertical line in the picture and black screens were very uneven (I am not sure how to describe it other than to say it looked like it was 'a black foggy mirror').  Amazon replaced it without a problem.  No problems with the replacement once you turn off the advanced picture controls.I bought an extended warranty for this TV also.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but S L O W
Reviews.Author: M. Vasey "Michael"
Reviews.Content: Picture is quite good. Smart TV aspects wortk fine. Remote is lame but I don't use it much. My main complaint is that it takes about 30 seconds to start up - much longer than any TV I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: AMcMahon
Reviews.Content: I own a 37" Vizio LED tv in my bedroom and have had nothing but positive things to say about it and looked to Vizio again for a TV when replacing a 50" Samsung Plasma (720p) television in my living room.  I was stuck between the E650i-a2 and the E601i-a3 (60") model. Ultimately I chose this one and have been pleased so far.  I bought the item elsewhere (dell.com) as Amazon's and Walmart's price has increased over $100 in the last few weeks on this TV.Setup was a breeze, and mounted to my old wall mount in a matter of minutes.  The TV comes on quickly and has a nice crisp picture from both my ROKU and Blu-Ray players.  I haven't tried a gaming console but will try to pull out an NES or SNES and hook it up to see how it does.  The TV is amazing although the color adjustment WILL need some tweaking out of the box,I have two gripes: One is that there is not any cable management if you are going to try to conceal the wires  I chose to wrap on HDMI cable over the tv and one under and ended up using zipties to keep the cables centered in the bottom of the TV The cables feed into this (essentially)  Wiremold CMK30 Screen Television CoverThe older slide remote was better in my opinion; this remote has buttons on both sides but works just fine.I would most certainly buy this TV again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Apps NOT downloading...
Reviews.Author: Patricia C. Delano
Reviews.Content: TV is great....except it will NOT download its own apps!!!!  The connection is fine, but it will not download Netflix, etc.  Spent close to 4 hours on the phone over 3 days trying to rectify with techs.  They're stumped and sending a tech out.  Not sure about this though.  I would prefer a new tv.  The tech may destroy it!  Did a lot of reading and troubleshooting with this problem - and it IS a problem.  Most people seem to get it fixed, but we're not having any luck - and my husband does IT for a living!!!  He's madder than you can imagine!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not disappointed!!! Would buy a Vizio again...
Reviews.Author: Jaybea20
Reviews.Content: Love this TV-love the price! This was the cheapest 65" TV out there when we bought it, and we have no problems with it at all. The crispness of the screen, great audio-and we would never buy a TV that's not a "smart" TV again. We have Hulu and Netflix, so it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 5 Star TV ~ Vizio is a Great Value!
Reviews.Author: navymom
Reviews.Content: The new Vizio E551i-A2 is light years ahead in picture quality and technology from the Samsung DLP we replaced. I had purchased a 32 inch Vizio 1080 in 2011 and because we loved its picture so much, we didn't seriously consider any other brand.Setup to get the Vizio up and running was easy with clear instructions and we were watching television in minutes.  A professional calibration of settings is expensive but I do recommend spending $20 to purchase the Disney World of Wonder (WOW) calibration disc to assist you in setting up your new Vizio. Thirty minutes using just the novice section of the WOW disc has made what was already a good picture to vibrantly pop off the screen. There is a section on Disney WOW to set up your sound, too.I suggest pairing a nice receiver, Blu-ray player and speakers with your system and you will never have to go to the movies again. We just watched "Star Trek Into Darkness" movie on Blu-ray. It was breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: Television
Reviews.Author: Ennis Bisbano
Reviews.Content: It met my expectations. It is what I wanted it to be.The picture is clear and bright. it fits into the room perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Samsung vs. Visio
Reviews.Author: De Marco Santana "Ralph 555"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Samsung 46 LCD TV for 5 years and decided to buy my 2nd TV because I wanted a Smart TV.  I must say that the picture quality is as good as my Samsung and I truly don't see any differences between the 2 TVs except for the brand :) The internal speakers' sound is great as well!

Reviews.Title: Sylvia
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Clear picture good color great sound just right for cabinet. The Costco low price and free extended warranty is terrific. Remote is great.

Reviews.Title: Numerous features, excellent buy!
Reviews.Author: Robert Smith
Reviews.Content: This is the first large screen TV I have purchased and it is loaded with extra features.  I have a 32 and a 42 inch TV that even though they are LED, they do not compare with this big screen.

Reviews.Title: Not a big fan :--(
Reviews.Author: Mick_1969
Reviews.Content: Read several reviews and thought I'd be able to tweak the picture enough to enjoy but that's just not the case. The picture just isn't bright enough and the colors just aren't not rich enough.  I've manipulated the settings to no end and to no avail.The picture also takes approx 30 seconds to appear after turning TV on.Decently priced, yes. Worth it? No, not IMO.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Jay Bananas
Reviews.Content: there are lots of picky, whiny reviews of tvs. I've had it about a month. This is a great TV at a great price. Amazon gets a perfect score for shipping arrangements, too. I also bought the 60" version of this a few weeks before for 998. also terrific. If you look for flaws then spend 500 more for a Samsung and maybe it'll be better.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Al E
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very good picture with great contrast and black levels. My old set was a rear projector which would steadily get dimmer as the bulb aged. This set has great brightness compared with the old one. I have owned it for about a month now and am very happy so far. I only have used the Netflix app so far, so I don't know how the other apps work. Netflix works great, but doesn't start very fast, probably 45 to 60 seconds to get going. I wish the remote had discrete power on and off commands and discrete commands for the different inputs, but that is a minor disadvantage.Overall, I am very happy with this TV

Reviews.Title: impressive 55 inch LED  razor HDTV by Vizio
Reviews.Author: Juan Sandoval "elsapoverde"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV 4 days now and I must say it is very "eye popping".  The definition is amazing, it looks like the people in movies and shows are there with you.  I thought it looked good on display, but must say it is much better in my tv area.  Lots of apps available, plenty of hdmi ports plus optical audio out - sounds tremendous with my surround sound system.  I called the Vizio help line during set up and they were outstanding in helping and so pleasant.  I spoke to a Ricardo and he assisted me quickly and I was on my way to enjoying this fantastic tv.

Reviews.Title: Much better the second time around
Reviews.Author: James J McManus
Reviews.Content: I received my first tv from CEVA completely smashed and was forced to refuse delivery. Amazon customer care could not have been more helpful. They apologized, and immediately put through another order. My first tv was delivered broken on a Tuesday, and the new one was delivered that same Friday, even though it was projected as Tuesday/Wednesday of the next week.I have not been able to tweak everything to my liking just yet, but so far i am thoroughly happy with the image quality. I play a lot of xbox and stream tons of content through hulu, amazon prime, and netflix, so I am happy with what I have seen so far.I was disappointed the remote doesn't come with the qwerty back, like some of the other televisions, since using the built in apps requires a lot of typing to search and input account names. Backlighting would also be nice. I searched for a Vizio iPhone app, but didn't find anything that didn't require a dongle for my iPhone.Is this the greatest tv on the market, no, but it is an amazing value and it has met all my expectations for a television of this size and price. Although I was very sad to have my first one arrive broken, Amazon has proven, with their amazing customer support, why I keep going back to them instead of the big box stores.Edit: May 2014. This Tv has been incredible for the price. I work from home 2-3 days/ week and constantly play xbox one, watch live streaming, or use the USB to play files and I could not be happier for the price I have paid. This is an amazing TV. I have it in a room with sky lights and the wash out is minimal considering the amount of light.  My only regret now is whether I should have bought the 65 inch instead for my living room...

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Great Value
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Dettlinger
Reviews.Content: Met all my expectations. Great picture, great styling, great price. The TV looks very modern and slim. The sound is decent for everyday TV viewing, but you will want an external source for movies and sports.  I spent a few minutes tweaking the picture to mine and my wife's preferences, and we are both happy. TV is in a bright room and we are able to see the screen just fine without annoying reflections or glare. Netflix and HuluPlus apps have a a good interface. My only complaint is a "long, 15-20 sec" start up time when powering on. Buy this TV. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Slim, sleek, and well worth it for the price.
Reviews.Author: Anderoo16
Reviews.Content: I always hesitate to buy electronics which are not name brand.  When it comes to Vizio though, I consider them a top-dog in the consumer TV market.  The picture is comparable to LED's which are priced $300-400 higher.  When I say comparable, I do not mean the same or better, I simply believe that the picture quality is great and for an average viewer, it is more than enough.The smart aspect of this TV is dull and not on par with competitors.  If you're serious about bringing content to your TV pick up an Apple TV or Ruko, you won't regret it.  Native UI's on smart TVs aren't quite there yet.Amazon is awesome as usual.  Hassle-free delivery.

Reviews.Title: Good so far!
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: I received this tv about a week ago and I am happy with it.  The other reviews for product are fairly spot on.I wanted to get a large set (55+) but did not want to sacrifice quality.  When browsing by price I noticed this TV based on its low price for such a large screen (coupled with a good number of HDMI in's, Smart TV capability, etc).  I was not interested in 3D so it sounded like a good match for me.  It is definitely a great value for the price.  The picture quality is great.  I would give it a 9/10.  Some of the picture settings do need adjustment.  I did read another persons review stating the tv took a very long time to turn on…it probably takes about 10-15 seconds.  Its not a big deal at all, you get used to it.  Not even noticeable anymore for me.My only complaints:1. Stand does not swivel left/right (it is also a little flimsy but it does the job).2. There is something up with the WiFi on mine.  It will not connect to my router.  I assume whatever wireless security I'm using is not supported by the WiFI card in the TV.  Not a big deal for me because I use an Apple TV rather than the apps that are preloaded.3. I've noticed while watching hockey there is sometimes a bit of a lag with the puck.  Its not always noticeable, but I assume that is due to the TV being 120hz vs 240hz.Overall I definitely recommend this set for the money.  It appears to be a quality product and the HD picture is perfect.JB Hunt delivered the TV without any issues and on time.

Reviews.Title: 65 inch Visio Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Brocco
Reviews.Content: Received my new TV and had it mounted on a living room wall. Picture is sharp and crisp. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: We are very pleased with this TV.
Reviews.Author: J. Lippelman
Reviews.Content: We have had no problems with this TV. I love how beautiful the picture is and the sound is clear.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: W. Rose
Reviews.Content: I am not crazy about buying "off" brands (Vizio is not a brand of Sony) but I heard some good things about Vizio and thought I'd give it a try.The one we got worked stright out of the box, unlike the LCD that has a washout right in the middle of the screen.The picture is great! Good sharp images, and the colors are spot on. Sound is good to, we dont have to run the audio through the Yamaha AV reciver, inless we want to.The built-in Wi-Fi was easy to setup, once I remembered what that password was, or the "key" is what it asked for. I'm waitted for the next party so we can give the YouTube a spin. Not sure if I want change my Netflex form it's current device. Think I heard somthing on the news about them not liking people using more then one device, not sure though.The price we paid was not bad eather, when compared to others. And no, I dont want 3D!

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: beth braun
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  Greater than I expected!  The picture is so clear!  Would highly recommend!  Love the app options as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Fellinia
Reviews.Content: Very nice quality picture in HD.  This TV is well made!  Crystal Clear Def. on HD- and the screen size is awesome.  Can also chromecast youtube onto the TV which is really neat!  The delivery and set up was great by amazon!  Would highly recommend this TV!  Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, perfect size.
Reviews.Author: Glen E. Davies
Reviews.Content: Love the tv. Would definitely recommend to others.  Price also cant be beat. Glad I went with the 65 inch.

Reviews.Title: No Amazon feature.
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: TV comes with built in Amazon Prime but Amazon said they don't support this TV.  It is even a function on the remote.  Also the audio randomly comes on full blast but if you wait 5 seconds it goes back down to normal.

Reviews.Title: VISIO E650i-A2 65 INCH 1080P SMART LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cabral
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE BEST TELEVISION I HAVE EVER OWNED , PREVIOUSLY OWNED MOVIES SEEM BRAND NEW , AWESOME VIEWING EXPERIANCE.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: David A. Lamberty
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything I wanted, and the Price was well affordable.I love the Options and the choice of Apps.

Reviews.Title: not DLNA compliant
Reviews.Author: J. demaria
Reviews.Content: Good picture-not great like the M seriesHuge problem for me is poor DLNA implementation and poor support from VizioSometimes it works, other times it rebloots the TV, works correctly about 20% of the time. Sometimes it hangs the YV, must be unplugged to reboot it.Firmware update are pushed randomly, there is no way to tell the TV to update. I have been waiting several months for the latest update.Support was no help with the DLNA issues, their answer is the TV is not DLNA compliant, even though most of the reviews said it was. To be fair to Vizio, none of their specs mention DLNA.Better off with a Samsung, their DLNA works fine.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Dean Peterson
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy to operate. Price was great. UPS delivered-packaging was wonderful. Would purchase again. Nice looking unit-love the small framework.

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Works perfectly with all the bells & whistles
Reviews.Author: Timothy Corcoran
Reviews.Content: This is a real bargain in this TV category as it includes all the "Smart" functions in a very nice package. The image is very crisp and the sound is adequate for a moderate size room.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Ramirez
Reviews.Content: It was a great purchase. I love the TV, it's picture quality is great it's features are awesome. I recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Review of Vizio Tv order
Reviews.Author: william gonnelli
Reviews.Content: The delivery was made in a timely manner.  The delivery men plug the TV in to see if it tuned on then left.  I was hoping they would have guided me on how house the set but they didn't.With respect to the V itself the picture quality is good and I am pleased with it. However the sound is poor.  In hindsight I should have ordered a 70" as opposed to the 65"

Reviews.Title: Great television.
Reviews.Author: Maltese Mom "Dawn"
Reviews.Content: Love this television.  Read reviews on several different brands but loved the picture of the Vizio that I saw at Sam's.  Wanted the 70" but it wouldn't fit in the space available so got the 65".  Very simple to set up.  Plan to get the sound bar soon.

Reviews.Title: Vizio nice price
Reviews.Author: I Just Shop Here
Reviews.Content: Prefect size the 55 inch model did not fit the bill for room size.  Vizio makes a great TV for their pricePicture is great mine is running though a Onkyo 3d receiver which upscales everything to 1080p.Also it improves the color even though you can't get true 4k picture from the TV the Onkyo improves the colorso much with it pass though its amazing it has taken a pretty good TV and made it much better.the only 2 faults I have with Vizio is their remotes and huge bezels. The remote feels crappy with bad response for the most part is way to dark in colors to see well. The bezel could be half the size to make the TV a little more stylish but any why that's just nitpicking on my part. Price picture all 5's style 3.5.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great delivery, a twofer.
Reviews.Author: Andy Lefebvre
Reviews.Content: Excellent T.V. Comes with wifi connection and smart apps. Picture quality was excellent and we love the 55" size. Input our password for wifi connection and we were good to go. We stream a lot of through  Netflix and Amazon Prime . The built in apps mean we don't need another device hooked up to the TV to stream these services.Amazon delivery was great. Delivery men brought tv into the house and placed it in a convent spot.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Cblaine
Reviews.Content: Very good product and is just as ordered.  The TV was delivered promptly and they even set it up and made sure it was running correctly.  I would order this again.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: William Foley
Reviews.Content: The sound is much better than I expected from the other reviews.  We watch a lot of Amazon Prime and the HD is superb. SD is also a huge improvement over the Sony rear projection set that the Vizio replaced. When powering up, it does take a bit longer to load all the apps and whatever else it needs but the extra time is no deal breaker to me.November 12 2013:It was nice to have better sound than the old Sony but when I compare it to my brother in law's Visio with a sound bar, I realized our set could use a lot of improvement.  I ordered a Visio 3820 sound bar.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV FOR THE PRICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Duce
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality picture once you get all of your settings in order.  The adaptive luma does lower the picture quality so I would recommend leaving this feature off. Overall, I'd highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV for it's value and price!
Reviews.Author: Anh T Le
Reviews.Content: No other brand can beat Vizio's competitive prices. Good quality for only a fraction of the price you would pay for other premium brands out there. Colors are bright and the sound is decent. Picture quality is good. The only issues I've had with this product is how slow the user interface is. For instance, loading up some the apps like netflix can take a while and is quite sluggish, but this may be true for most smart TV's today anyways.

Reviews.Title: Great TV... Have 4 of the same now.
Reviews.Author: Diane Fulton
Reviews.Content: I bought my first vizio for a game room (55") because I wanted a 1080p 120hz at a lower cost than samsung.  The Vizio was not only lower in price, it was a smart tv with built in wi fi.Since, I've purchased a 47", 50" and this model for other rooms and one for outdoor, by the pool.  All of these TVs have crystal clear pictures, easy to use remotes with built in buttons for netflix and amazon.  There are no cons to the TV.When TV was delivered, the delivery man removed tv from box and plugged it in to ensure no damage in shipping.  Awesome job!!!

Reviews.Title: Budget LCD with a Subpar Picture
Reviews.Author: ELECTRIC WIZARD
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my den where I primarily watch Football & Baseball games. I watched several football games on this TV and no matter how much I tried I could NOT get the picture to look good. The colors were not rich and seemed dull. The colors did not POP or seem to have any life. Also, there was considerable motion blur when the football was thrown. If you primarily watch sports I can NOT recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: So close to being perfect
Reviews.Author: jon e koenig
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am very happy with this.  The picture quality is close to fantastic, with only a couple minor annoyances.  Automatic room light adjustments can sometimes be unstable, and tend to be on the dark side - perhaps I will just disable. And there is a faint band near the right edge that appears sometimes.  Being near the edge, it is tolerable and I'll learn to ignore it.  Otherwise, the picture is stunningly great, the remote works well, and I am very pleased.  Call it a 4.5 rating.

Reviews.Title: Nice Right Out of the Box
Reviews.Author: Howard S. Robins
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced an Element TV that was damaged in moving.  That TV had a built-in JBL sound bar, which provided terrific audio.  I am not an audiophile or a videophile, and these are not the highest end devices.  This Vizio is great for the price.  It is LED backlit, and you can adjust the backlighting to suit your ambient conditions.  Picture quality is crisp across the screen, no issues that I could see.  If you are going to plug this into your home theater system, you should be happy with the audio.  The internal speakers, while they sound OK, they are rear-firing, which is not optimum and are there, because every TV has speakers.  I used the analog audio output jacks to use the auxiliary input on a Bose Wave radio.  This was better than the rear firing speakers, but still not satisfying.  I finally bought a Vizio soundbar and use the PCM option and optical link to connect the two devices.  The TV has all the options, and optical is the best interface.  I am a happy camper now.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Richard Pastorino
Reviews.Content: One of the best TV's I have owned.  I have two other Vizios which is why I bought this one. Color is great. Only CON is that the speakers are in the back.  Need to invest in a Surround System to really make this thing work. Shipping was great. They delivered it and set it up, took the box and away they went.  Would recomment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: All that I hoped for
Reviews.Author: JSMet
Reviews.Content: The clarity of the picture on this set is awesome. I used a high quality hdmi cable to connect with a high def cable box, and it seems to me to make a big difference. In fact my daughter complained that the movies we watched were "different"; they looked different because the clarity made the movie sets look like movie sets, we aren't used to this type of clarity. Everything works well on my set, I'm as happy as a clam.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Watch List
Reviews.Author: Norman Ballard
Reviews.Content: For a smart tv you have to get a Roku receiver to see the Amazon watch list on prime instant video. Instant videos are available,but not those that you choose for your watch list.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: ddanster91
Reviews.Content: You will get alot of tv for the money and a nice picture for the price.This tv looks great with my ps3

Reviews.Title: Visio pros and cons
Reviews.Author: Bob 34215
Reviews.Content: Tv picture is very good. Sound system is not great. Have to buy a separate system (maybe a sound bar) to understand much of the conversation. I subscribe to direct tv and get to the Internet through it. Probably the smart part of the tv is not necessary.

Reviews.Title: THIS THING IS FREAKING HUGE!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dee&Gee;
Reviews.Content: The screen on this thing is huge!  Sound comes out the rear of the TV so you have to turn up the volume a little more, but would be awesome with a sound bar.  Ordered my from the warehouse deals that Amazon offers and it didn't come with the screws for mounting it to the stand so went to Lowe's and got some.  Overall, you will not have eye strain watching this TV at all.  It's like your own Cinema in the living room.

Reviews.Title: An excellent value but...
Reviews.Author: K. Candler
Reviews.Content: Would be 5 stars but sound quality is not as good as my 55" Mitsubishi. Excellent picture though, and fits my wall unit perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Vizio is tops!
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL TURNER
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture and sound. Easy to set-up. Visible from entire room. Haven't used all the systems yet because I just went through eye surgery but I'm looking forward to all of them. Michael

Reviews.Title: E650i-A2 rocks
Reviews.Author: bigtuna9
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, I am soo happy I chose VIZIO! The 65" picture area is significantly larger than 55" and 65".  The industrial design is awesome and very minimalistic.  I also love having internet connectivity build into my TV for Netflix, Hulu, etc.  Thank you VIZIO and Amazon!

Reviews.Title: poor quality picture
Reviews.Author: wes ryan
Reviews.Content: Horrible television. Really poor blacks, weak contrast and extreme light bleed around the entire bezel. Sent it back for a Panasonic plasma and am extremely happy with that decision.

Reviews.Title: My first Vizio
Reviews.Author: Peggy Lewis
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous to buy a Vizio tv after reading all of the bad reviews about the models from last year. (E601 and E701)  I'm very much a name brand person.  Anyway, I bit the bullet and bought the model from this year, hoping they fixed the problems from last year....only time will tell with that.  My first impressions out of the box were not that great.  All of the colors seemed washed out compared to my LG.  I adjusted my settings to match my LG, knowing that settings do not work the same for all tvs, but I just wanted a starting point.  After about an hour watching different sources, I got the settings dialed in to my liking.  I must say that this tv has a great picture.  I've been watching it for about 4 days now, and I'm almost completely happy.  The blacks are a lot darker than my LG, but that may be due to it being direct lit instead of edge lit.  I only have 2 problems with this set.  One, is the start-up time.  Seeing as this is a smart tv, I'm assuming that apps slow it down a bit.  The second is the Smooth Motion and Real Cinema.  These options are supposed to make the picture less juddery, but I've found on some shows and movies that the picture is more juddery.  It's not enough to be bothersome and I probably wouldn't have noticed it, except that I was looking for problems because it was new.  Anyway, after disabling those features it was no longer a problem.  I only briefly played with the apps and they seemed to work well.  One other thing that I found was that I could not find a media server that worked with the Vizio's DLNA.  Every one that I tried said that the codecs were incompatible, and I tried 5 different servers.  All in all, I like this tv for what it is....a low cost alternative for a larger screen television.

Reviews.Title: The remote stinks
Reviews.Author: Electro-Techno Phobe
Reviews.Content: **The Remote Stinks! ** the TV it's self seems terrific and would have given 5 stars except for remote.  Color looks incredible, sound better than decent, features work as advertised. But the remote is totally useless - very agravating to use.

Reviews.Title: Not a good TV
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this product got its 4.5 stars review rating. There are issues, Display quality is not good for a new TV standards.Delivery:Got delivered 1 day earlier as promised.One man for the delivery job, so I offered help to set it up.There is an instruction that the TV need to operate above temperature of 50 degree F. Since outside temperature is much lower these days, so the delivery guy suggested me to wait a while in room temperature before turning it on. Ok.He also suggested me to keep the box in case that I need to return it. Ok.Turn it on:Before tried to turn it on, I connected the HDMI cables. By doing that, the TV turned on by itself. Not sure it is by design or a problem.The remote control is not responsive. I had a very hard time to cursor through the initialization. Turn out that remote control has problem.The display is very dark. I saw other reviewer talking about turning off light sensor. After did that, display became better.I had FIOS setup box. It was used earlier with an Sony 55 inch, 1080p setting. By connecting to this TV, the setup box setting was changed to 720p. Later, spent some time to figure out and changed it back to 1080p.Also, I could not change the FIOS setup box channel. I think the new TV's remote control kept on sending out bad signal and jammed the FIOS's setup box. Removed the batteries from new TV's remote, FIOS setup box became functional again.I headed out to buy a $10 replacement remote, worked.TV took 20 seconds to turn on. Changing input (from TV to DVD) took 15 seconds.Tuning the picture:After turning off the light sensor, with the "standard" display setting, it is still dark. Turned the setting to "vivid", the display's brightness became similar to my 6 years-old 55 inch Sony default display. That is what I am using now. Not sure if it is a defect.The sound:Sounds is good for a LED-LCD TV.The build and stand:It has thin trim which is good, but the TV itself is bulky. The TV wobbles a bit if I push it on the side or connect cable. But it is fine standing by itself.Smart TV:With the bad remote, didn't use it much. I tried Netflix, took forever to bring it up.Overall:I didn't feel it is a good TV at all. It seems to be a stretched TV in size from my 6 years old 55 inch TV, and darker, not so vivid display. Also not very responsive to input, even with a "good" remote.Will I return it, NO.Will I recommend it to friends, NO.Am I happy with it, NO.Worth $1200 in price? If it works perfect out of the box, Maybe. I didn't expect much for a TV with this price. But NO, with the hassles of the remote and setting it up.2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Beware! SONOS owners
Reviews.Author: StudioSteve "tenebre"
Reviews.Content: Vizio Tech support will immediately blame your computer when your remote stops working and the TV becomes sluggish.They will say you need to disable file sharing. They will not provide instructions at all. (just disable DLNA for the TV itself withing your computer)now it may still have issues if you own a SONOS system. Vizio tech support solution "turn off your SONOS". Nice tech support!FYI - this can be fixed if you have a  router that has isolated guest accounts. the VIZIO TV does not play well with any other networked devices!!!! it must be isolated completely. BUYER BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Aaron Cook "cookieblz"
Reviews.Content: I know this probably will not happen to everyone, just a heads up. Received the television from CEVA out of Tulsa. They seemed very professional, called to confirm delivery time about 2 hours ahead of schedule. Scheduled time came and went. A late night phone call said the driver was in the area but the TV was "sitting on the dock" back at the warehouse. They rescheduled for the following day, same time.I received the TV within the shipping window. No obvious damage to the box, some light scratches. The screen was cracked/shattered completely across the top. There was also a strangle bubble at the top about the size and shape of an ostrich egg.Didn't even try to mess with it, called Amazon and they offered to either pick it up and refund or come to my house and trade another out. I'll update when the next one comes in.On another note, this is my first and only negative feedback on Amazon. This is also the most expensive purchase I've made through them. Not sure if there is a connection there, but I didn't have a problem with buying a TV online until now.Happy shopping!

ProductInfo.Features:
VIZIO Internet Apps - TV, Movies, Music, Apps
Razor LED for richer colors and more vivid details in an ultra thin design
Built-In Wi-Fi for easy internet access
120Hz Refresh Rate with Smooth Motion for stunning detail and clarity in every image
1080p Full HD for a crystal-clear picture
ProductInfo.Name: VIZIO E551i-A2 55.0-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV
